titleStmt.title: J. W. Ogilvie et al. to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG5460

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
To his Excelency Tho E Bramlett
Govenor of Kentucky

The undersigned Citizens of McCracken County and anply interested for the peace and well being therof And hearing that efforts are being made to procure a pardon from your Exclenecy for J J Tatman convicted of Killing J D Heady and therefor sentenced to the penitentiary for two years Would respectfully petition and remonstrate against any such clemency believing that he is by the law Justly condemned and that the good of society and public opinion accords that he suffer the penalty of his crime

J. W. Ogilvie
T. E Ashbrook
J. E. George
Mutton Scott
J. B. Saunders M. D.
Benj D Lacy M D
R Saunders M. D.
Joseph Ullman
Waytt Jones
Thos. Grundy
